content:  Hashing (SHA-1, SHA-2, SHA-3, and SHAKE)  Random Number Generation (PRNG, DRNG, and TRNG)  Elliptic Curve supported operations: – ECDH[E]: • P256, P384, and P521 • X25519 and X448 – ECDSA: • Keygen, sign, and verify • P256, P384, and P521 88 IBM z16 (3931) Technical Guide – EdDSA: • Keygen, sign, and verify • Ed25519 and Ed448 For more information about cryptographic functions on IBM z16 servers, see Chapter 6, “Cryptographic features” on page 209. IBM Integrated Accelerator for Z Sort (on-core) Sorting data is a significant part of IBM Z workloads including batch workloads, database query processing, and utility processing. The amount of data that is stored and processed on IBM Z continues to grow at a high rate, which drives an ever-increasing sort workload. Introduced on IBM z15 was the sort accelerator that is known as the IBM Integrated Accelerator for Z Sort (see Figure 3-13 on page 87). The SORTL hardware instruction that is implemented on each core is used by DFSORT and
